org.fluentjava.closures
Class Closure

java.lang.Object
  org.fluentjava.closures.Closure
Direct Known Subclasses:
ClosureOfAMethod, ClosureOfAMethodName, Predicate, PriviligedClosureOfAMethodName
public abstract class Closure
extends Object

Approximation of the concept of closure on Java, abstracting a function definition. It is not really a closure, as it does not close around the environment. Instead of subclassing this class, try using ClosureCoercion static methods.

toInteface

public <T> T toInteface(Class<?> clazz)
Adapts self to a Interface. IMPORTANT: All methods invoked on the interface will trigger call, so be careful when adapting interfaces with several methods.

Type Parameters:
T - Inferred type.
Parameters:
clazz - Interface to be adapted
Returns:
A proxy to self.
